name: Transient Global Amnesia
chief_complaint: I suddenly couldn't remember anything for a few hours, and now I'm confused about what happened
prognosis: Excellent, typically no recurrence and no long-term effects
description: A temporary, sudden-onset episode of memory loss that can't be attributed to a more common neurological condition, typically lasting 4-6 hours. Patients remain alert and maintain personal identity but cannot form new memories or recall recent events during the episode.
risk_factors: Recent physical exertion or emotional stress
